content: 4 on the sole measure your gauge at the sole as the sole stitches tend to have a different gauge than the lb stitch section the toe section will have 22 row determine how long your toe section will be with my sole gauge that s 6 1 cm / 2 4 and subtract it from your foot length continue to work in pattern until you reach the foot length where you will need to start the toe section the toe just read don t knit yet there will be two different kinds of rounds in this section we will need to get rid of the lb stitches while working the decreases decrease round instep k1 in c1 ssk in c2 if the next stitch is an lb stitch slip all three stitches individually as if to knit return them to the left needle and knit them to- gether through the back loop work in pattern to last three regular instep stitches k2tog in c2 if there s an lb stitch just before the first stitch to k2tog knit all 3 stitches together k1 in c1 sole k1 in c1 ssk in c2 work in pattern to last three sole stitches k2tog in c2 k1 in c1 non-decreasing round instep k1 in c1 k1 in c2 work in pattern to last two regular instep stitches k1 in c2 k1 in c1 sole k1 in c1 k1 in c2 work in pattern to last two sole stitches k1 in c2 k1 in c1 now back to your needles and knit work a total of three times  1 decrease round  2 non-decreasing rounds work a total of three times  1 decrease round  1 non-decreasing round work decrease rounds until you have 13 stitches on both the instep and sole sides 26 stitches total - not counting any remaining lb stitches break yarns c2 and c3 work 1 round in c1 k1 ssk if the next stitch is an lb stitch slip all three stitches individually as if to knit return them to the left needle and knit them to- gether through the back loop k to last 3 regular stitches on instep work ssk instead if the stitch behind your current stitch is an lb stitch k2tog k1 repeat on sole stitches graft the remaining stitches using c1 please note that vortexia enigma and its description of course is not a real plant but a work of fiction 6 legend c1 c2 c3 explanation rs knit ws purl p the lb stitch with the other strands in front of it rs k2tog ws p2tog ssk m1 m1 lb stitch backwards loop with the other strands in front of the loop sl1 no stitch c1+2 c1+3 c2+3 p the lb stitch with the indicated colours hold the other strand in front of it 7 n b ia l lp 1 1 t t r r a a h h c c 8 chart 2 lb chart 2 plain 9
